title: Please nerf Draven.
body:
Literally no one can 1v1 this Champion.

He has a ridiculously safe Lane Phase and Incredibly strong Late Game.

His only weakness aside from picks where basically anyone is dead is his Axe catching and because you buffed it and because he can basically direct it - he is literally not countered by skillshots.

The only two Champions that can really skillshot him when he's axe catching (Jinx, Ashe and Cait) and do so from a safe distance don't scale as hard as he does and cant handle trades with him because of his attack range and creep aggro and if you choose to bail on a trade or even mid-trade his Stand Aside and W just make him automatically win the trade or allow him to completely decimate you.

I understand he has other weaknesses in that other Champions provide harder CC and are more desired for their increased range, better CC or better pick potential but when it comes to 2v2 Lanes where there isn't a lot of teaming etc he is just a joke to deal with at all stages of the Game unless he plays one handed.

I swear I have only ever won against this Champion once and that was because the player was drinking coffee with one hand and texting with the other.

replies.body:
I remember playing a normals game and the enemy team had a gold 5 draven while our whole team was pre 30. It felt unfair and he obviously steamrolled us completely but surprisingly, even though he was that ahead, if we bring some good cc and lock him down so he cant pick his axes up, we can easily 3v 1 him. Keep in mind, this is a snowballing draven so a 1v1 or even a 2v1 is out of the question. Without his axes, his damage is mediocre.

Also draven's trading power is really strong but he's like a completely single target melter. Sure his stand aside and his ult is multi target but those arent the reason why draven is so strong. Shut him down early with a gank from your jungler and he wont be able to snowball. You see the longer draven goes without dying, the more dangerous it is to die to him. And draven's snowball potential is only really unlocked with kills because of his passive. Meaning he *has* to play risky to snowball in any way. He also has very little utility.

Laning against him is a pain but if he got nerfed he wouldn't ever be viable. Picking draven into a game means you're either really confident with your skills and you believe you can snowball, or it means your bot lane is gonna feed hard.

Hes feast or famine, much like some of your most played champs, Riven, Kat or, too a lesser extent, Vayne. If he gets ahead then he will steamroll you and theres nothing you can do to stop it but hes somewhat short ranged and if you have a pick champion like Morgana, Blitz or Thresh aim your skillshot to where his axe is going to fall and its a free kill or if he has a brain in his head he won't risk it and he loses 85% of his main damage output and it gives you a window to engage on him. Lets put it this way, Draven is only OP if his Spinning Axes are up.
